replies.body: Long term we've got a full rework planned for Urgot. That's a long way off though, he's both a big project and not first in the queue. Shorter term (starting next week) we're going to explore some small, quick buffs for him. Hopefully find some stuff to help him out a bit in the meantime without reintroducing any of the problems that lead to him getting heavily nerfed in the first place.

Whatever the change is, I hope it's something that provides an alternative approach if you miss your E. Right now it's land an E and rock, or miss an E and your opponent has free reign over the lane.

Hello, Mr. **Meddler**, sir (*& team*)!  =D

I have some ideas regarding a *short term* fix/**rebalancing + QoL** for {{champion:6}}, that may put him in a better spot, in terms of more intuitive gameplay.

It's mainly a *minor kit swap* between his **W-Terror Capacitor** & **E-Noxian Corrosive Charge**.
I was wondering if the **Movement Slow** from his *W-Terror Capacitor* could be switched with the **Armor Reduction** from his *E-Noxian Corrosive Charge*..?

-----

So, the abilities would now be:

* [W] - Terror Capacitor:  Urgot charges up his capacitor to gain a shield.  While the shield is active, Urgot gains **armor reducing attacks**.

While the shield is active, Urgot's attacks & missiles **reduce (*possibly "steals", instead?*) the target's armor by 12/14/16/18/20%** (*same as current/live values, unless you guys intend to change it?*).

* [E] - Noxian Corrosive Charge:  Urgot launches a corrosive charge that damages enemies in an area and **slows targets**.

Enemies afflicted by the charge have their **Movement Speed reduced (*possibly "stolen" as well?*) by 20/25/30/35/40%** (*same as current/live values, unless you guys intend to change it?*).  Urgot's basic attacks & missiles also **slow** the target **while they're afflicted**.

-----

My reasoning for this switch is basically the same reasoning as with Rework {{champion:72}}'s Movement Slow shift to his E-Fracture, and Rework {{champion:79}}' Movement Slow shift to his Q-Barrel Roll (which I also posted about, a *long* time ago:  [Gragas - Switch Enemy Speed Debuffs](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2572371)  .)

* Thematic cohesiveness/intuitive logic

* Using a spell that activates a shield (*W-Terror Capacitor*), **just** to be able to use its Movement Slow function, just isn't intuitive in terms of gameplay.  And swapping these functions in his kit would certainly make his gameplay become more intuitive & improve his learning curve.

* Also, using a spell that looks very chromatically similar to {{champion:29}}'s W-Venom Cask (*E-Noxian Corrosive Charge*), but *doesn't* **slow**, is just plain *confusing* (*especially for players who like to play both champions - {{champion:6}} {{champion:29}} - and are trained to think that the abilities are consistent with each other*).
-----

Additional Fixes:

* Allow Urgot to move while casting Q & E. 
(**QoL Fix**, *for more intuitive gameplay; helps with learning curve/improving gameplay skills.  I don't remember if he can, or can't, as I haven't yet..'retested' him this week & it's been forever since I've played him, but it doesn't look like he can from his videos*.)

* [R] - Hyper-Kinetic Position Reverser:  Both Urgot & the suppressed target are untargetable until the reversal channel is completed.
**Reasoning**:
This helps solidify the.."fantasy" (*original intention/design/vision?*)..of the ult, so that it doesn't simply turn into a glorified Root/Stun, allowing both teams to kill the champions being reversed, while the reversal is still in progress.
Instead, it forces both teams to wait for the reversal's channel to end, & decide whether to engage a teamfight, peel for/protect their displaced teammate, somehow manage both, or disengage & leave their teammate to die.  (*"Counterplay"?*)

-----

(*Trying to think of what else to say, to further flesh-out my ideas, but that's all I've got.  I think I've said it all?*)

Anyways, I hope you guys consider implementing these fixes for Urgot!  =D
He's a fun champ that I want to unlock & play more often (*especially with his Battlecast skin!*  =D ), but the current state of his kit has kept me from playing him to the best of my abilities, and my proposed changes would certainly allow me (*& possibly others*) to play him better.

(*I also have some ideas for his larger rework, but I'll save them for when the official thread for that appears*.)

Thank you for your time & for reading this!  =D

Honestly, I don't think Urgot is a bad champion at all, just misunderstood and out of place in the meta.

In short, he's not an ADC, he's a solo laner. When built as a tanky ranged bruiser, Urgot is actually a rather intimidating lane bully. His EQQQ combo can chunk a squishy down to nothing mighty quick. With tank items, you can actually use your R to engage and get out alive, which is something ADC Urgot can rarely pull off. 

The problem is that Urgot is dead-last in the popularity contest, and player bias pretty much prevents anyone from getting real practice with him. If you try to join Team Builder as Urgot, you'll be waiting for an eternity, only to be kicked from the party when the team flames the captain for accepting an Urgot. If you're the Team Builder captain, everyone will leave the lobby the second they see an Urgot on the team. If you're in blind or draft, someone will dodge out when you pick Urgot. 

And if you're lucky enough to actually get into a game with Urgot, you'll probably be stuck playing ADC in the bot lane, a role for which Urgot is subpar at best (since he's out-ranged by just about every ADC and his ultimate is useless if you build damage over tank, which you HAVE to do if you're the team's designated ADC). Trying to get practice playing Urgot in top or mid lane is usually a fruitless endeavor.

It's really a community bias that puts the nail in the coffin, and I believe the brunt of that bias stems from the word "Marksman" that comes attached to him. If Riot were to "re-launch" Urgot with minimal changes, but actively promote him as a solo laner instead of an ADC, I think it would help his popularity a whole lot.

Except Urgot was designed to be played in the bottom lane. He was played competitively in LCS as part of a bottom lane duo. Before his nerfs, he had a way longer range on his abilities than he does now, helping to keep him even against those pesky long-range ADCs. In combination with his utility and ability to lockdown a single-target from -700- range at rank 1 of his ultimate, he was very strong in the early-mid game. He was the definition of an anti-carry and was released at a time when hypercarries (a la Vayne) was the meta for a long time.

It was only after his heavy nerfs to his ultimate, E cooldown, and to the bonus AD scaling on his Q (switching it to a less scaling but scaling on total AD) that he does better as a solo lane bruiser. Yet the biggest nerf, IMO, was the nerf on the range of his locked-on Q (1500-1200). A 300 range decrease is definitely nothing to laugh at. Although because of the huge range anyway, you can see how he was such an overbearing lane bully.

I had a quick suggest to fix urgot. I had seen that the team at riot was working with the gate like ability and have a similar idea that is less broken and would be able to code by coding in the opposite fashion of yasuos windwall.Here is my idea for the urgot rework:

Q: Increase the range of his q but not the scaling and allow for a passive that when his ultimate is active his auto attacks have increased range equivalent to his acid hunter.  The reason being for the ultimate and E change

W: Shield applies a stronger slow but at the cost of a reduced shield scaling and has built in damage reduction scaling up to 20% as a passive (can be altered it just seems like he would need it since his ult no longer would contain it but wouldnt want his shield to get destroyed immediately opening up the option for kiting and for counterplay since it would only take a small amount of damage to stop his shield.) 

E: have his autos and acid hunters apply a DoT effect and armor shred but not have a tracking ability when activated and call it something that implies the person is marked. this correlates with his new ultimate. (allows for bully potential as well as a possibility for correlation with the ult to make him a single target anti-carry focus)

R: His new ultimate can either be for him or himself and allies but is stated as such "Urgot opens a Dimensional Transfixer for 3 seconds that allows for skillshots (his or his allies depending on the gameplay riot chooses would be balanced) and his auto-attacks to auto target a designated character effected by his e as long as the character is in range of the skillshot. (this allows for correlation with the e so that he can be an anti-carry and allow focus to a single character for burst.)

This rework would allow for counterplay in the fact that the q w and e would remain very similar to his gameplay and only the ultimate paired with the skillshot of e would allow for a single target burst to fulfill his roll as an anti-carry. it strengthens his other abilities to allow for a kiting off tank bruiser who has a small to medium margin in which to kite his enemies depending if hes auto attacking or casting. This also allows more playstyles and build paths since his acid hunter as well as his auto attacks are affected by his kite. The decision would be to go with either attack speed like an adc or a typical urgot build towards a caster anti-carry you normally see. This would improve gameplay and strengths of his core kit while maintaining the style urgot currently embodies and puts him on a very limited window to burst his target down. This requires the player to be skilled enough to pull off his burst effectively or be punished for it.
